html: The prophet’s vision of Babylon’s desolation is so grievous it is almost too much to bear. He can’t rest peacefully at night as the horror of it recurs to his mind. The imagery of a woman in labor defines Jehovah’s Day of Judgment for all the earth’s inhabitants, some for good, others for evil (Isaiah 13:8; 26:17-18; 42:14; 66:7-9). The attack on Babylon catches the wicked unawares—when people are preparing tables, decking them with candlesticks, and eating and drinking—perhaps during a national holiday that coincides with early summer as predicted elsewhere (Isaiah 16:9-10; 18:4-6; 22:13; 28:1-4).
